intro: Rinorea welwitschii, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade. Rinorea welwitschii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
